turns.query: best Italian restaurants in SoHo

results.name: Raoul's
results.summary: Raoul's isn't just a restaurant; it's a time capsule of downtown cool, where the steak au poivre is legendary and the bartenders have seen it all. Expect a tightly packed room, a late-night buzz, and a solid chance of spotting a celebrity hiding in a corner booth.

personalization.forUser: Okay, so Raoul's is a scene, full stop. But if you're craving that buzzy, late-night energy you get from live jazz, and you're okay with a wait, the steak au poivre is legendary.

places.address: 180 Prince St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: We scored our second reservation here this year on a cold, snowy day when everyone was canceling. The inside is comfy and warm and tight but a great homie feel. We are set up with our same waitress. We had early this year, Aimee, who is hands-down with the best personalities and waitresses we‚Äôve had in New York. She remembered me because no one else ever orders the cocktail the Paper Plane. We went with the classics again and got the stick off of a burger up above with the artichoke vinaigrette. All hands down one of the best steaks, the best burgers any of us have had in a long time. Thanks Amy for the recommendation to head to Pete‚Äôs Tavern afterwards for the full Christmas bar feel.
reviews.author: Harris Lowe

reviews.text: I had an exceptional experience at Raoul‚Äôs. Truly beyond expectations. The food was outstanding; I ordered the steak, which was cooked to perfection and incredibly flavorful. The wine pairing complemented the meal beautifully, enhancing every bite. The service was warm, attentive, and made the entire evening feel special. Raoul‚Äôs consistently delivers a memorable dining experience, and this visit was no exception. Highly recommend!
reviews.author: Zhanna Arsirii

reviews.text:
My favorite thing about this place was the atmosphere. Really enjoyed the art and overall decoration. It was really hard to find a reservation but eventually booked for Sunday 9:45pm a month prior. Their specialty is the Steak au Poivre which was okay for what you pay. Really recommend the crab beignets as an appetizer
My favorite aspect of this place was the ambiance. I thoroughly enjoyed the art and overall decor. Although it was challenging to secure a reservation, I eventually managed to book a table for Sunday at 9:45 p.m. a month in advance. Their specialty dish, the Steak au Poivre, was satisfactory considering the price. However, I highly recommend the crab beignets as an appetizer. They serve 12 burgers a day, so if you want that, I recommend going as soon as they open.
reviews.author: zeynep dark

results.name: Il Buco
results.summary: Il Buco feels like stepping into a rustic Tuscan farmhouse, right in the middle of SoHo. Their salumi selection is incredible, and don't skip the olive oil tasting ‚Äì it's surprisingly educational and delicious.

personalization.forUser: Jordan, you'll love this place. It's got that rustic, old-world charm that might scratch your 'world' music itch, plus the Mediterranean menu has enough going on to keep you from missing Thai food for one night.

places.address: 47 Bond St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: Came for the NYE price fixe dinner. Everything was amazing! The dishes were adventurous and executed beautifully. Was blown away by the attentive service as well. Will definitely be coming back.
reviews.author: Rebecca H

reviews.text:
Good food and nice service!
Food was delicious, but the cooking was unfortunately not even. Many of us eat a steak and some got well done when they ordered medium rare. I was lucky to get a perfectly cooked steak and it was fantastic. Otherwise I can really recommend this place.
reviews.author: Philip Modig

reviews.text: We had a wonderful anniversary dinner and look forward to going back next time we visit New York. Our server was excellent and informative, as was the bartender who was warm and welcoming and very helpful in selecting a sparkling wine. The ambience was perfect and romantic, the food was the best I can recall (and we dine out frequently). The flavors were just impeccable. We had the bikinis, veal chop and tagliatelle with black truffles. Salted caramel dessert was also lovely. A perfect evening.
reviews.author: A

results.name: Lilia
results.summary: Lilia's mafaldine with pink peppercorns and parmigiano is legendary for a reason ‚Äì it's simply incredible. The buzzy atmosphere makes it perfect for a celebratory group dinner, but book well in advance or be prepared to wait at the bar with a negroni.

personalization.forUser: Okay, so Lilia's in Brooklyn, not SoHo, but hear me out: if you're chasing that handmade pasta perfection like you find in excellent Thai noodle dishes, *this* is the spot. The vibe is buzzy, and you'll love it.

reviews.text:
Super friendly staff and a great place to spend an evening catching up with friends. We booked a 6pm patio table, so we didn‚Äôt see much of the inside, but it was packed so reservations are a must.

The patio was perfect though, plenty of separation from the sidewalk and a comfortable setup. Most importantly, the food was fantastic. It‚Äôs not cheap, but the portions were fair and everything felt thoughtfully prepared with real attention to detail.

If I were to recommend two things, it would be the focaccia and the agnolotti, they were the table favorites.

Overall, we had a great experience and would absolutely recommend it.
reviews.author: Rohin Gupta

reviews.text:
I usually hear people going before they open to get a table, and was so excited that I was able to reserve online!

The staff were nice and helpful with deciding our orders, and we were glad that we did not skip on the focaccia!

I was way too full afterwards, so I think the 2 of us could‚Äôve just gotten one pasta instead of 2 (or just one appetizer)!
reviews.author: Vicki

reviews.text:
The service at this place is truly amazing! The food is good, but nothing special enough to make me want to return. For the scallops, you only get two small pieces for $30.
The pastas we tried received big recommendations, but they were lacking flavor.
The only thing I liked is the apple crostata. I wish it came with ice cream not the creme fraiche.
reviews.author: Anja A.

results.name: Charlie Bird
results.summary: The bucatini cacio e pepe is a religious experience; perfectly al dente pasta coated in creamy, peppery goodness. It's a perpetually packed, buzzy spot with a hip-hop soundtrack, which somehow *works* with the upscale Italian food.

personalization.forUser: Okay, so maybe Italian isn't your usual Thai or Peruvian thing, but hear me out: the roasted chicken here is seriously good, and the vibe is pure downtown cool ‚Äì think a jazz soundtrack (your jam!) with a buzzy, energetic crowd.

places.address: 5 King St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: Fun lively restaurant with excellent food, highly recommend the beef tartare served with fried squash blossoms, the pork chop and the roast chicken! Normally don‚Äôt love large proteins the most, but they were amazing. The pastas (gnocchi and cavatelli) were ok, and the crudos were small but very nice. Would go back, love the fun r&b/hip hop soundtrack.
reviews.author: Maria Yu

reviews.text: Sorry to say but although I had high expectations from this place, it felt uneventful. And I mean that in a bad way. It looks and places itself higher than the actual delivery. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, it was not a bad experience. But they aim to offer more
reviews.author: Alex Achim

reviews.text:
Charlie Bird is very much a presentation first establishment in my eyes. It's not bad by any means, but I am pretty disappointed especially since the food looks better than it actually tastes (not bad, just very average).

Razor clams: Tangy, slightly savory, but you should prob pass on it at $7/pp.

Burrata Crostini: it looks amazing, but there was no flavor. I literally only tasted the crostini.

Farro Salad: Nice composition of flavors, but it doesn't really stand out.

Tuscan Fried Chicken: Fairly flavorful and juicy, the best of the appetizers. But honestly, you are much better off going to a restaurant dedicated to fried chicken.

French Fries: Actually really good, crispy and salty. If I ever came back, I would always order these with my meal.

Chicken Milanese: ....the little side salad and the jam was the best part. The crust is the milanese is crispy and salted well, the chicken itself is cooked well..... But the chicken itself was not seasoned.

The portions were okay overall.

I'm not a picky eater by any means, but I was pretty disappointed overall with this meal. Maybe I was there the wrong day, but I left fairly disappointed. Although I rated it a 4 overall by NY standards, I would personally consider the food a 3/5 as I doubt I would ever return myself.
reviews.author: Khang Tran

results.name: Sant Ambroeus
results.summary: Sant Ambroeus feels like stepping into a Milanese cafe ‚Äî their cappuccino is textbook perfect, and the profiteroles are practically mandatory. Don't miss their signature panettone during the holidays; it's shipped directly from Italy.

personalization.forUser: You'll probably skip this one. While it's undeniably chic, it's more about the scene and less about the kind of intense, flavorful experience you seek out in cuisines like Thai.

places.address: 265 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: We came here for lunch on a warm September weekday and the outdoor area was at full capacity. Would definitely recommend making reservations. The service and food was impeccable. We had the artichoke and arugula salad with grilled chicken and BLT followed by the famous ‚Äúprincess cake‚Äù for dessert.
reviews.author: Mish__ elle08

reviews.text: Very friendly service! It‚Äôs such a nice restaurant and I love the terrace on sunny days. The spicy rigatoni plate was very good and the Princess Cake is the best princess cake I‚Äôve ever had. Perfect lunch break in Soho.
reviews.author: Chayma F.

reviews.text:
truly a 10/10 experience. the wait staff was professional and just stellar. and you can tell looking at this place they take their service and standards seriously.

no doubt in my mind this has to be a staple of soho culture.
reviews.author: Mic!

results.name: Altro Paradiso
results.summary: The ricotta ravioli with brown butter and sage here is the stuff of dreams‚Äîsimple, perfect, and unforgettable. This is the kind of place where you want to linger over a bottle of wine and pretend you're in Italy, even if just for a couple of hours.

personalization.forUser: Okay, the cacio e pepe here is next-level, and the whole place has that effortlessly cool vibe you usually find in spots playing jazz. It's popular, so maybe snag a reservation way ahead.

places.address: 234 Spring St, New York, NY 10013, USA

reviews.text:
We had a mixed experience here with the food, however the service was good.

We started with the finocchio fennel salad which was the best thing I ate all day, the dressing was superb. The arancini was crunchy with good flavor but it was served cold, which we didn‚Äôt like. Chicken Milanese parmesan was huge and tasty enough. Pasta cacio e pepe was decent.

The biggest disappointment was the dessert. The pear galette had a super salty crust that was challenging to eat, perhaps it should have been an appetizer. The meringue-ata cake had a weird texture and was basically inedible. It felt like biting into butter, not in a good way.

I am glad I tried the restaurant but don‚Äôt think I will go back.
reviews.author: Andee Dug

reviews.text: Altro Paradiso checks all the boxes. Superb food, attentive but never intrusive friendly service, warm atmosphere, inventive delicious cocktails, and approachable and thoughtful wine list. The sommelier was also warm and friendly and is clearly passionate as well as knowledgeable about wine and he took his time to explain the history of each wine he recommended and what makes it so special and how it pairs with each plate (many of which we have not seen anywhere else). The Caio e Pepe is the best we have ever had and beats any version of this dish we have had in Rome. How they prepare a basically three-ingredient dish so beautifully is nothing short of magic. The same applies to the other dishes on the menu that we have tried. Simple, fresh ingredients that Italy is famous for, prepared beautifully with just the right balance to enhance the flavors both individually and as a whole.  Altro Paradiso makes the whole experience seem effortless,  and we always leave feeling happy and taken care of, looking forward to our next visit.  Delizioso!
reviews.author: Diamond Geezer

reviews.text: This restaurant has a beautiful interior and the service is good, but I wasn‚Äôt impressed with the food. The antipasti mussels were just okay, the swordfish was too salty, and the spaghetti pomodoro was underwhelming. Overall, the food felt below average compared to the ambiance.
reviews.author: Aroma & Adventure

results.name: Olio e Pi√π
results.summary: This place nails the rustic Italian vibe, with vines crawling all over the facade ‚Äì perfect for people-watching. Get the Cacio e Pepe; it's simple, but the execution is flawless.

personalization.forUser: Okay, the cacio e pepe here is RIDICULOUS, and I know you'll appreciate the simple perfection after a complex Thai meal; however, be warned, it gets LOUD.

places.address: 3 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA

reviews.text:
Went for lunch and the place was packed, but I got lucky and managed to grab a seat. The energy was great and the service kept things moving smoothly despite the rush.

The carbonara ‚Äî their most famous dish ‚Äî was incredible. Perfectly cooked pasta with a rich, savory sauce that hits all the right notes without feeling heavy. Easily one of the best I‚Äôve had anywhere.

The ravioli was also fantastic ‚Äî flavorful, delicate, and cooked to perfection. Every bite showed real technique and high-quality ingredients.

Overall, an outstanding lunch. I‚Äôd happily come back to explore more of the menu.
reviews.author: d o

reviews.text: The atmosphere was good, but keep in mind that portions were small. The polpo antipasti was a tasty start, and the truffle gnocchi was flavorful, but the ragu ravioli was easily my favorite dish of the night. Good quality, just on the smaller side!
reviews.author: Ji Young Lee

reviews.text:
Absolutely loved our experience at Olio e Pi√π. The food and drinks were incredible from start to finish. The carbonara was amazing, perfectly al dente, rich, and full of flavor, easily one of the best I‚Äôve had. Drinks were just as good and paired perfectly with the meal.

Our server Maria was wonderful! She was attentive, friendly, and made the whole experience even better. She checked in at all the right moments and made us feel so taken care of. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!
reviews.author: han chu

results.name: Torrisi Bar & Restaurant
results.summary: The baked clams are an absolute must-order ‚Äî they're plump, briny, and swimming in garlic butter. Don't sleep on the house-cured meats either; the mortadella is a revelation.

personalization.forUser: Okay, so this isn't Thai, but hear me out: the red sauce here is next-level, and the whole place has that chaotic, beautiful energy you find in the best experimental jazz shows. Plus, it's right in your budget.

places.address: 275 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text:
Torrisi NYC literally exceeded my expectations in every possible way, and I‚Äôve returned quite a few times because it never disappoints. From the moment we walk in, Arianna at the front greets us with a warm smile and makes us feel welcome every time, and the atmosphere of the restaurant is the perfect balance of chic and cozy. The service is flawless from start to finish, and the food is everything and more.

To start, the sesame sourdough bread is unreal‚Äîso good, I honestly don‚Äôt have words for how yummy it is. The tortellini pomodoro deserves a 100/10 if I could‚Äîliterally melts in your mouth, light, airy, and bursting with flavor.

The chicken alla griglia is tender with a perfect balance of sweet and savory, and the sauce‚Ä¶ unbelievable. The Cucumbers Newyorkese are super refreshing, and the scalloped potatoes are herby, light, and a perfect side‚Äînot your classic heavy potato dish.

And the affogato? Chef‚Äôs kiss. üë©‚Äçüç≥üíã

Drinks are solid‚Äîdirty martini, Aperol spritz, and a glass of chardonnay all hit the mark. On top of that, the complimentary cookies and Italian ice are a fun and delightful addition to the experience.

Overall, Torrisi NYC is exceptional in every way‚Äîamazing food, impeccable service, and a dining experience I keep coming back to because it never fails to impress.
reviews.author: Esha Patel

reviews.text: Best of the best in New York City. Impressive crowd, understanding service and a charm to be there. Be thoughtful on what to order, flavors are numerous and choices have to be made well. Out of the larger glamorous restaurants in the city this one did impress. Only small issue is how there are only two bathrooms, otherwise its amazing.
reviews.author: Naum T.

reviews.text: I‚Äôve been wanting to try this for so long and they definitely delivered. I‚Äôm so impressed. The inside is gorgeous and the bar is incredible. I got the ham appetizer and it was a fun way to eat. The tortellini is probably the best I‚Äôve ever had. It just melts in your mouth
reviews.author: Neha

results.name: Carbone
results.summary: Carbone's spicy rigatoni vodka is legendary for a reason, and the whole scene feels like stepping into a Rat Pack movie ‚Äî think red sauce, strong cocktails, and a celebrity sighting or two. Just be prepared to drop some serious cash; this isn't your average neighborhood joint.

personalization.forUser: Okay, so Carbone is an experience, not just a meal, and it's LOUD. The old-school Italian-American vibe is fun, but if you're craving something like **Ethiopian**, this isn't it; more Scorsese than Jim Jarmusch.

places.address: 181 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text:
Carbone absolutely lives up to the hype. The spicy rigatoni is perfect‚Äîrich, decadent sauce with just the right kick. The chicken Massimo was surprisingly good: sweet, beautifully charred on the outside, tender on the inside, and finished with a deliciously creamy sauce. It came with shallots which were cooked perfectly!

The baked clams were excellent (loved that you can substitute bacon for breadcrumbs), and the Caesar salad was a generous portion made tableside with anchovies‚Äîclassic and delicious. The bread was good with a solid assortment and one that was cheesy and a bit oily. There was no fresh mozzarella available that day, but they made up for it with olive oil and pickled cauliflower.

Some folks say the place is cramped, but we were seated at a round table so we thought it was more than enough space for us to enjoy a nice meal.

Finished with a delicious raspberry sorbet, which was solid. Overall, a flawless meal and a true 10/10 experience. Would absolutely return.
reviews.author: Salem A

reviews.text:
We dined at Carbone many years ago, before all the hype, and at the time thought it was a solid experience with generous portions. This visit, however, I completely understand the buzz.

Despite being 20 minutes late to our reservation, we were graciously seated on a packed Saturday night ‚Äî a great first impression. The Caesar salad was phenomenal, with bold flavors and an unforgettable sauce. The beef tartare and spicy vodka rigatoni were definite standouts.

The ribeye was good but felt a bit heavy with the sauce. Dessert more than made up for it ‚Äî the carrot cake with ginger ice cream was excellent.

What truly sets Carbone apart is the ambiance. Cozy, intimate, and beautifully styled with real candles and timeless music, it feels like stepping into a glamorous 1960s supper club. Elegant, lively, and full of character ‚Äî a memorable dining experience from start to finish.
reviews.author: Yuliya Lubin

reviews.text: EPIC. INCREDIBLE. BEST MEAL IN NYC! I‚Äôve been wanting to come here for years! Bucket list experience ACHIEVED! I will be trying to find spicy vodka rigatoni that good for the rest of my life. Lemon cheesecake was the best I‚Äôve ever had as well. Start to finish, the meal was indulgent and the service was unparalleled!
reviews.author: Braquel Whetsell

results.name: Bar Pitti
results.summary: Don't expect anything fancy, just unbelievably good, simple Tuscan dishes like the pappardelle al ragu. It's cash-only, cramped, and always packed, but the people-watching on the sidewalk tables is half the fun.

personalization.forUser: Since you love Ethiopian food, you're probably down to try new things‚Äîbut honestly, skip this one. It's all scene, no substance, and the wait is brutal.

reviews.text:
Bar Pitti is a very charming Italian restaurant, really well located and with a lively atmosphere that makes it a great spot to enjoy a meal. The ambience is warm and welcoming, and you‚Äôre attended by Italian servers, which adds an authentic touch to the experience.

We started with bruschettas topped with prosciutto, which were excellent‚Äîsimple yet full of flavor. They also brought fresh bread with olive oil to the table, a nice classic touch. For the main dishes, we tried a few different pastas. The truffle fettuccini was good, but honestly, the truffle flavor wasn‚Äôt as strong or rich as we had hoped. The carbonara, on the other hand, was excellent‚Äîcreamy, flavorful, and definitely the highlight of the meal. The tagliatelle with marinara sauce was fine, though nothing particularly special.

One thing to note is that the restaurant does not accept credit cards, which is quite unusual and a bit inconvenient. On top of that, an automatic 18% gratuity is added to the bill, which I personally did not like, as I prefer to decide the tip myself based on the service.

Overall, Bar Pitti has great vibes, attentive service, and some solid dishes‚Äîespecially the carbonara. But the payment policy and the mandatory gratuity are definitely something to keep in mind before going.
reviews.author: Francisco Sim√≥n Verger

reviews.text:
Cafeteria vibes, average pasta, and an automatic tip ‚Äî overpriced for the experience.

I was excited to finally try Bar Pitti, but it didn‚Äôt live up to the hype. The space is extremely tight (even for NYC), and the whole experience felt more cafeteria/assembly-line than cozy Italian. Dishes came out fast but without much care. The pasta and mushrooms looked fine but tasted pretty flat.

For four people, our bill was about $270, the tip was automatically added without being clearly communicated. The receipt even suggests gratuity, so it‚Äôs easy to accidentally tip twice. Just something future guests should know.
reviews.author: Sara Bailey

reviews.text:
I waited ~40 minutes in line last night at Bar Pitti, which is first come, first serve. As we reached next to be seated, the bald owner/manager deliberately seated three separate groups behind us.

When I calmly and non-confrontationally said that we were ahead of those groups, he became confrontational, dismissive, and openly hostile. He then gaslit me, falsely claiming the people behind us had been waiting longer, which was objectively untrue and visible to everyone in line.

To make it worse, he attempted to seat yet another couple (who were also behind us) ahead of the group in front of us. That couple actually spoke up themselves because even they knew it was wrong. Instead of correcting the situation, the owner became aggressive with them as well, creating a scene in front of the entire line.

This was not confusion or a mistake. It was arbitrary, rude, and disrespectful behavior from someone who clearly abuses their position. Plenty of restaurants in NYC are busy. Very few treat customers with this level of contempt.

Food aside, the front-of-house experience is hostile and unprofessional, and I will not be returning. If you value fairness or basic respect, spend your time and money elsewhere.
reviews.author: Dev Wada

turns.query: something quieter and more romantic, candlelit

results.name: One if by Land, Two if by Sea
results.summary: Housed in a historic carriage house, this spot oozes old-world romance. Expect impeccably prepared classics, and don't be surprised if a proposal happens nearby ‚Äì it's *that* kind of place.

personalization.forUser: This place SCREAMS romance, Jordan! Picture this: candlelit tables, a cozy carriage house, and maybe even some live piano ‚Äî it's got that old-school charm.

places.address: 17 Barrow St, New York, NY 10014, USA

reviews.text:
One If by Land, Two If by Sea was absolutely spectacular. Walking in felt like stepping into a storybook‚Äîthe soaring ceilings, glowing chandeliers, and beautiful holiday d√©cor created the most magical atmosphere.
The food was outstanding from start to finish. The escargot was perfectly prepared, the Beef Wellington was exceptional, the French onion consomm√© was rich and comforting, and the chocolate souffl√© was the perfect ending. Every dish felt special. They offer both a three-course prix fixe and a seven-course tasting menu, which makes the experience feel even more elevated. Yes, it‚Äôs expensive‚Äîbut absolutely worth it for a special occasion or a truly memorable night out. The pianist sat right in front of us and played so gently it felt like the music was floating in the background‚Äîelegant, intimate, and unforgettable. The service was impeccable, the cocktails were just as wonderful as the food, and the entire evening felt incredibly romantic. A truly unforgettable dining experience and easily one of the most romantic restaurants in New York.
reviews.author: Georgia Panagiotakos

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of taking my wife here for our anniversary, and the experience was exceptional from start to finish. From the moment I made the reservations, the staff graciously accommodated all my requests. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted at the door and assisted with our coats, setting the perfect tone. The atmosphere was enchanting, and the chef‚Äôs curated courses were nothing short of amazing, with outstanding food selections. The customer service (our waiter Albert was great) and hospitality were impeccable throughout. No complaints whatsoever‚Äîjust pure delight for the evening. If you‚Äôre planning on visiting there‚Äôs a parking lot right across the street
reviews.author: Jeffrey Hernandez

reviews.text:
SUPER OVERPRICED!
I overall like the restaurant! Dim lighting, piano, tables are so nice. Price is super high though! They force you to order 3 course meal which is 160$ for each person and at the end of the night we ended up paying 500 dollars for 2 people. I think it‚Äôs way too much for the food, service and experience we‚Äôve received. It‚Äôs super overpriced.And our waiter smelled stinky.. he definitely needed a shower..unfortunately.
reviews.author: Leman Ozdag

results.name: The River Cafe
results.summary: With breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline, The River Cafe is an iconic, if pricey, experience. The chocolate Brooklyn Bridge dessert is pure theater, and the live piano music seals the deal for a special occasion.

personalization.forUser: Skip this one, Jordan. While the views are incredible, it's often buzzy and a bit too scene-y for a quiet, romantic night out.

reviews.text: Visiting this restaurant is an experience, not just a meal. Everything about it our visit here was fabulous. For us it was a splurge while visiting New York, to celebrate our Engagement, and The River Cafe kindly gave us a window table for this special occasion. The skyline looking back across New York from under the Brooklyn Bridge was truly spectacular. New York even decided to have it start snowing while we were there which meant we walked out into a winter wonderland. There was also someone playing the piano which added so beautifully to the ambiance. The food was flawless.  Everything we ordered was taste profile balanced and so yummy. There were complimentary little entrees before our chosen entrees arrived. The pace of food coming to the table was not rushed. The service was excellent. The only thing I can think of to enhance the meal/experience would be a palate cleanser. I would highly recommend a visit to the River Cafe.
reviews.author: Kirsty

reviews.text:
Dining at The River Caf√© is truly about the experience. We had the three-course meal, and the overall presentation was elegant. The environment was very cozy and romantic, with beautiful views under the Brooklyn Bridge, and the staff was nice, attentive, and amazing throughout.

While the courses were well presented, the desserts felt quite costly and didn‚Äôt fully meet expectations for a Michelin-level experience, as the flavors were a bit bland.

I‚Äôd recommend visiting in the summer if you want to fully enjoy the atmosphere and surroundings. Overall, it‚Äôs a memorable place mainly for the setting and service.
reviews.author: Manik Kumar

reviews.text:
An exceptional dining experience with a stunning waterfront setting. We celebrated our anniversary here and everything felt special ‚Äî impeccable service, outstanding food, and beautiful attention to detail, including a handwritten message on the dessert.ü•π‚ù§Ô∏èüòç

One small note: our reservation required an extra confirmation despite having already confirmed via WhatsApp. A quick call resolved it, and although we were initially seated away from the window, we were promptly moved when a window table became available. Overall, a memorable and elegant experience.
reviews.author: Lourdes Ruhstaller

results.name: Il Buco
results.summary: This rustic-chic spot feels like stepping into a Tuscan farmhouse, right in the East Village. Their house-cured meats and extensive wine list are highlights, and the dimly lit ambiance is undeniably romantic.

personalization.forUser: You'll love this, Jordan. It's got that rustic, candlelit vibe you're after, and the small plates are perfect for sharing ‚Äì plus, their wine list is insane.

places.address: 47 Bond St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: Came for the NYE price fixe dinner. Everything was amazing! The dishes were adventurous and executed beautifully. Was blown away by the attentive service as well. Will definitely be coming back.
reviews.author: Rebecca H

reviews.text:
Good food and nice service!
Food was delicious, but the cooking was unfortunately not even. Many of us eat a steak and some got well done when they ordered medium rare. I was lucky to get a perfectly cooked steak and it was fantastic. Otherwise I can really recommend this place.
reviews.author: Philip Modig

reviews.text: We had a wonderful anniversary dinner and look forward to going back next time we visit New York. Our server was excellent and informative, as was the bartender who was warm and welcoming and very helpful in selecting a sparkling wine. The ambience was perfect and romantic, the food was the best I can recall (and we dine out frequently). The flavors were just impeccable. We had the bikinis, veal chop and tagliatelle with black truffles. Salted caramel dessert was also lovely. A perfect evening.
reviews.author: A

results.name: La Grenouille
results.summary: A true classic, La Grenouille is the epitome of old-school elegance. The floral arrangements are legendary, and the souffl√©s are not to be missed ‚Äì this is where you go to feel transported.

personalization.forUser: This is pure, old-school romance, Jordan. Think impeccable service, stunning floral arrangements, and classic French dishes ‚Äî it's the ultimate special occasion spot.

places.address: 5 Beekman St, New York, NY 10038, USA

reviews.text: Came here for a 5pm dinner on a Saturday. We had a reservation and got there on time and our take wasn‚Äôt ready since they just open at 5pm. Service was excellent. I had leftovers, about a quarter of the burger and fries. It came with pork belly which i asked to be on the side and also ate later. The burger was delicious but messy. Came with lettuce, tomato, cheese and aioli. Since i had the French onion soup which was very delicious, that filled me quite a bit. I tasted the cr√®me dessert which was like a cr√®me br√ªl√©e without the top being charred. The space was exactly like French bistro. The bar area isn‚Äôt large and by the time we left at 7pm there was about 5 people waiting and ask the tables were occupied. I will say they are quite pricey but their restaurant week menu made it somewhat affordable. My items were only on the regular menu.
reviews.author: Mariuxi [Mary-ook-see] Tapia

reviews.text:
Chef Daniel‚Äôs casual French bistro. The food was delicious. The ingredients were fresh, the seasoning perfectly balanced, and nothing felt overly heavy or pretentious.

The staff were friendly and welcoming, and the service was smooth from start to finish. t
The atmosphere is warm, relaxed, and charming without trying too hard. It has that perfect balance between casual comfort and a touch of refined French elegance.
reviews.author: perle75nyc

reviews.text:
After some spectacular weekend adventures, we decided on Le Gratin for brunch. This is the signature restaurant of chef Daniel Boulud,  located in the Tribeca area of Manhattan. Upon entering one is transported to old France with notable and opulent appointments throughout the space. The open dining room is flanked by gorgeous wood and tile work and adorned with gorgeous ambient lighting throughout. We were seated in a corner booth that provided an entrancing view of the entire space.

We began our meal with an order of the Escargot Gratines Au Persil and the Francine Salad.  The Escargot were prepared with ample garlic and butter and served simmering with crusty bread as an accompaniment.  The salad was a fresh and beautiful mix of frisee, lettuce, thinly shaved carrot, radish and onion, topped with a beautiful housemaid white cheese. Both were delectable starters to what would be a spectacular lunch. For our main courses we selected the Steak Frites and the Branzino.

The steak was cooked to medium perfection, tender, juicy and well-seasoned and was accompanied by a generous portion of crispy french fries.

The Branzino fillet was perfectly cooked, flaky and moist, bathed in a sinfully delicious beurre-blanc, probably the best version I have tasted and accompanied by a delicately flavored rice pilaf studded with minced zucchini.  Craving a bit more green, we also ordered the Haricots Verts a la Ciboule, a green bean dish with an absolutely delightful scallion butter.

We finished our meal with the Apple Tart Tatin. The soft apple caramel atop a luscious cookie, served with Rum Raisin Ice Cream were a delicious denouement!!

Le Gratin has pretty big boots to fill with chef Daniel Boulud at the helm, and I believe it does so effortlessly! I highly recommend it for French food aficionados!!!
reviews.author: Epicurean Belletrist

results.name: Daniel
results.summary: Daniel Boulud's flagship restaurant delivers refined French cuisine with impeccable service. The tasting menu is a splurge, but the wine pairings are expertly chosen and elevate the entire experience.

personalization.forUser: You'll adore this, Jordan. It's elegant and refined, but still has a warmth to it, and the tasting menus are an experience. It's not quite as quiet as some other spots, but the ambiance is top-notch.

places.address: 60 E 65th St, New York, NY 10065, USA

reviews.text:
This was my second time dining at DANIEL, and once again it reminded me why this restaurant is so special and why I return every time I‚Äôm in New York City.

From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with genuine warmth and gracious hospitality. The host and the manager who seated us were welcoming, attentive, and made us feel truly cared for. Throughout the evening, the service was impeccable ,polished yet friendly, professional without ever feeling distant.

The sommelier was exceptional, offering thoughtful wine recommendations that paired beautifully with each course. The tasting menu was a true work of art: beautifully crafted dishes, elegant plating, balanced flavors, and pairings that elevated the entire experience. Every course felt intentional and refined, yet comforting at the same time.

One of the highlights of the evening was having the pleasure of meeting Daniel Boulud himself. Despite being incredibly busy and on his feet all evening, his passion for cooking and hospitality truly shines through. He took the time to stop, chat with guests, and make everyone feel welcome and happy  a rare and meaningful gesture from a world-renowned chef.

DANIEL is not just about extraordinary food; it‚Äôs about heart, warmth, and genuine hospitality. An unforgettable experience, every single time.
reviews.author: Par Chiturai

reviews.text:
I recently visited Daniel in New York City and experienced their tasting menu, and the entire evening was truly exceptional. From the moment I arrived, the service was warm, welcoming, and incredibly professional. The staff guided each course with genuine knowledge and attention, making the meal feel effortless and perfectly paced.

The tasting menu itself was a remarkable journey. Every dish was beautifully presented with meticulous detail, showcasing refined technique and bold yet balanced flavors. Each course felt intentional‚Äîtextures, colors, and tastes coming together in a way that showed the kitchen‚Äôs skill and creativity. The ingredients were clearly top-quality, and the transitions between courses were thoughtful and harmonious.

The wine pairings elevated the experience even further, complementing each dish without overwhelming it. The ambiance of the dining room added to the enjoyment‚Äîelegant, serene, and polished without feeling stiff or overly formal. It created an atmosphere where you could relax and truly savor every moment.

Overall, my experience at Daniel was extremely pleasant and memorable. The tasting menu was refined, artful, and satisfying, and the impeccable service made the evening feel special from start to finish. I would gladly return for another celebration or fine-dining experience.
reviews.author: Charlotte Saint-Hague

reviews.text:
I recently visited with my sister, Tina Stewart, who has raved about Daniel for quite some time ‚Äî and now I completely understand why. From the moment we arrived, the entire experience was nothing short of exceptional.

The wait staff was absolutely top notch ‚Äî Zach, Matt, and the bartenders all went above and beyond. Attentive, knowledgeable, welcoming, and genuinely kind. You could tell they take pride not only in their work but in the experience they create for every guest.

The food‚Ä¶ there truly are no words. Every bite was incredible. Flavorful, thoughtfully prepared, and clearly made with passion. Getting the opportunity to see the kitchen was an added bonus and only deepened my appreciation for the care and skill that goes into each dish.

It was an amazing night filled with outstanding food and even better people. Experiences like this stay with you ‚Äî they aren‚Äôt just meals, they‚Äôre memories.

Until next year, I wish you all a fantastic year ahead. This is an absolute must-go place. If you get the chance, you owe it to yourself to have this experience at least once in your life. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
reviews.author: Jamie Terhaar

results.name: Per Se
results.summary: Thomas Keller's Per Se offers a meticulously crafted tasting menu with stunning Central Park views. The 'Oysters and Pearls' sabayon is a signature dish, and the attention to detail is unparalleled, making it a truly special (and expensive) experience.

personalization.forUser: Per Se is amazing, Jordan, but it's a bit formal and pricey for a truly relaxed, romantic evening. Save this one for a celebratory occasion when you're ready to splurge.

places.address: 10 Columbus Cir, New York, NY 10019, USA

reviews.text:
An unforgettable dining experience at Per Se, and one that truly lives up to every one of its three Michelin stars.

From the moment you step into the main dining room, you‚Äôre immersed in elegance, a beautiful, serene setting overlooking the park, elevated further by the warm glow of the fireplace that creates an inviting and refined ambiance.

The tasting menu offered both vegetarian and meat/fish options. I chose the vegetarian menu, and it was hands down the most delicious tasting menu I‚Äôve had in a long time. Every dish was thoughtful, balanced, and impeccably executed. The mushroom pie was absolutely out of this world- a luxurious blend of exotic mushrooms, seared to perfection, rich yet incredibly refined. The Doppio Agnolotti with butternut squash emulsion and chestnut confit was a standout as well, a flawless combination of sweetness, depth, and texture.

The meat menu was equally impressive. The perfectly seared Mediterranean Lubina and the delicately cooked farmed venison showcased remarkable technique and flavor, leaving nothing to be desired.

Service elevated the experience even further. Samantha, our server, was exceptional- warm, attentive, and impressively knowledgeable about every dish, making the meal feel both personal and seamless.

Per Se is truly worthy of each and every star. A flawless culinary journey from start to finish, and an experience I will remember for a long time to come.
reviews.author: Esfira Shakh

reviews.text:
Background
Per Se is synonymous with a rigorously precise, French inspired tasting menu experience. Even its shorter menus are designed to reflect the full philosophy of the kitchen rather than serve as a compromise.

Ambience
The dining room is dimly lit and serene. While we were not seated in the main dining hall, our table faced the New York skyline, which added a cinematic calm to the evening. The space felt formal yet not stiff, elegant without intimidation.

Service
Service was impeccable and precise. Staff were attentive without hovering and thoughtful without excess. The presence of a vegetarian menu executed with equal seriousness deserves special praise.

Food and drink
The four course menu was skilfully crafted and coherent from start to finish. Each plate showed restraint and clarity. The true revelation was the dessert course. It was a masterpiece of balance and whimsy, arguably the most compelling and memorable sequence of the meal. It is one of the best if not the best dessert. Kudos

Overall
Per Se proves that greatness is not dependent on length or spectacle. Even a shorter menu delivers depth, confidence and emotional payoff.
reviews.author: Peter Gan

reviews.text: Per Se? Directly in from of Central Park? A horse ride after dinner? We love Per Se ! ! Delicious, classy, elegant & romance by the fireplace. Excellent food. Excellent service. Beautiful ambiance & location. We had the tasters menu & what a delight it was! Per Se is well deserving of its 3 star Michelin rating! Could Per Se be a candidate or reason a new 4 Star system is created?Orrrr, was that the reason for Michelin removing 1 star from Per Se's neighbor? Masa... Hmmmmm. We shall find out! We highly recommend Per Se!
reviews.author: JaySan Avante

results.name: Balthazar
results.summary: A bustling brasserie that transports you to Paris, Balthazar is a New York institution. The towering seafood platters are a must-order, and the people-watching is as good as the food.

personalization.forUser: I'd skip Balthazar, Jordan. It can be super loud and crowded, definitely not the quiet, romantic vibe you're looking for.

places.address: 80 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: A very pleasant experience. The snails were excellent, the onion soup was not bad, I had meat, the cooking and flavour were top notch, the fried potatoes were tasty and fresh, and the service was excellent. This is a place I would love to visit again and again. Nicase was wonderful, very helpful and made us feel very welcome. We are very grateful to her.
reviews.author: Serap Oyal

reviews.text: This restaurant has been on my wish list for quite a while now and since we were going to be in the city on Saturday, I met a reservation a month ahead of time. We had a reservation for 7:30 PM, but we were finished with everything we were doing and slowly worked our way down to Spring Street and arrived at 6:55 PM. We asked the ma√Ætre d‚Äô if we can possibly have a table and we were actually seated right away. Our server reminded us of the actress in Amelie, Audrey Tautou. She was very attentive & friendly. I started out with an old-fashioned and my partner had a glass of red wine, both were very good. We both shared the goat cheese and caramelized onion tart for an appetizer, and it was absolutely delicious. We are actually going to try to make this at home ourselves at some point. The crust was very light. My partner had a short ribs with polenta and I had beef bourguignon with mashed potatoes. He said the short ribs were the best he ever had. My meal was also very good. For dessert, we both shared the Paris Brest. It consisted of choux pastry with a hazelnut cream filling. My partner likes hazelnuts more than I do but I do have to admit it was very good. I also have to compliment the gentleman who kept filling my water glass, it never went empty. He was very attentive and friendly. Looking forward to coming back at some point, I heard the breakfast is very good there. We enjoyed the atmosphere and the people watching.
reviews.author: Richie A

reviews.text: Whenever we‚Äôre in the city, this is the place to go for breakfast or brunch. I haven‚Äôt been there for dinner yet but it‚Äôs a gem. Service impeccable, a bit noisy but that‚Äôs because it‚Äôs always packed so reservation recommended. Just love the croissants and my wife had the bouillabaisse which was delicious and the Norwegian Benedict. I had was absolutely delicious with the smoked salmon. We will be back!
reviews.author: Carl Haugen

results.name: Minetta Tavern
results.summary: This historic Greenwich Village tavern exudes old-world charm. The Black Label burger is legendary, and the dimly lit, wood-paneled interior makes it a cozy spot for a romantic dinner.

personalization.forUser: You'll love this, Jordan. It's intimate, dimly lit, and has a real old-world feel. Their black label burger is a must-try, and the ambiance is perfect for a cozy date night.

places.address: 113 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: Order the GRILLED OYSTERS!! They are spectacular. Always a great time at Minetta. We made our reservation for late lunch or early dinner and this was lovely around 3pm on a weekday. Still a great menu. Cocktails are great. Husband got the espresso martini and it was very well made as was my Bloody Mary. I ordered us both prosecco as well that was delicious. The waitstaff was wonderful- Ashlyn was our server and she was very accommodating as was the manager on duty, Clark. From the fresh warm bread to our entrees everything was delicious. The Duck Ragu with Pappardelle pasta was great, al dente, homemade to perfection. The filet mignon was cooked very well, charred nicely on the outside. Sides was lovely and the desert was rich and delicious! Highly recommend for a nice brunch or dinner or even just cocktails and the grilled oysters.
reviews.author: Amanda Cross

reviews.text:
I was so excited to finally try this classic spot!

Service overall: 10/10.
The restrooms were clean, which is always a good sign.

For food, we tried the Black Aged Burger (medium) and‚Ä¶ wow.
Honestly, it was orgasmic üòÇ A burger without cheese? Yes ‚Äî and it was incredible. You could really taste the flavor of the meat: soft, juicy, buttery, and perfectly cooked.

We didn‚Äôt have cocktails, but we ordered wine and it was great. Also, they definitely pour more than 4oz, which makes it even better üòâ

Totally recommend!
reviews.author: Camila Aldana Crudo

reviews.text: What a NY gem. So glad we planned my Birthday weekend to include Minetta. Was concerned about even while having a reservation that we would have to wait but luckily got seated within 3 minutes! Front room by bar is super crowded due to people waiting on their tables, but was so happy to be in the back room. We had a table facing out and appreciated the epic table! You can see the old school NY vibe in the pics. Our server was super efficient as well as the staff that helped with water and bread. My water glass was filled every few minutes! Husband had the maple Old Fashioned and said it was one of the best he‚Äôs ever had (and he‚Äôs for sure an OF snob)!! For food we started out with the onion soup which was excellent and the petit salad (not so petit)! For an entree we actually split the black label burger PLUS cheese which was absolutely incredible. Fries were insane too. Passed on dessert as we were just so maxed out!
reviews.author: Julie Toulas

turns.query: casual ramen spots near me

results.name: Tsujita LA Artisan Noodle
results.summary: Tsujita's pork is legendary‚Äîmelts in your mouth. The dipping ramen (tsukemen) is the way to go; ask for the 'soup wari' at the end to dilute the remaining sauce with hot broth for a satisfying finish.

personalization.forUser: This is the spot for rich, deeply flavored tsukemen ‚Äì you'll love the dipping noodles, especially if you're craving something beyond the usual ramen experience.

places.address: 2057 Sawtelle Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90025, USA

reviews.text:
Came here specifically to try their world-famous tsukemen, and it did not disappoint.
This isn't just a meal; it's an experience.

The cold, perfectly firm noodles are meant for dipping into that incredibly rich and complex broth.
The flavor is deep, savory, and utterly addictive.
Following the recommended ritual, squeezing in the lime wedge for brightness and later diluting the broth with the provided soup stock transforms the dish and makes every bite interesting until the very last drop.

Be prepared for a line, as this place is a true destination on Sawtelle.
The service is efficient and focused on getting you to the good stuff quickly.
For anyone looking for an authentic, standout noodle experience in LA, Tsujita is an absolute must-visit.
reviews.author: Irwan McGregor

reviews.text: Really good ramen spot with lots of Naruto art and merch. They had their own IPA which I liked it was very smooth and paired with the ramen nicely. There wasn‚Äôt a long wait on a Saturday morning I would come back to try their dipping ramen. I got the spicy chashu ramen and it was delicious! The pork was thick and the egg perfectly cooked.
reviews.author: Kevin Madrigal

reviews.text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Ten stars if I could. Best noodle shop on Sawtelle.

For the last two years, Shoko and Josh have made Tsujita LA Artisan Noodles feel like a second home. They‚Äôve memorized my order, welcomed me like family, and consistently delivered the best noodles on the street.

I‚Äôve eaten here up to 3x a week sometimes, rotating between the tsukemen and ramen‚Äîand it never misses. The noodles are elite, the broth is dialed, and the consistency is unmatched. But what really sets this place apart is the service from their entire staff and especially Shoko, Josh and let‚Äôs not forget Suki and Mama San! Genuine, warm, and always on point - there is no place like it on Sawtelle.

If you‚Äôre on Sawtelle, eat here first. You won‚Äôt be disappointed!!!

üçúüëè
reviews.author: Carter Koch

results.name: Daikokuya Little Tokyo
results.summary: Daikokuya is pure, unadulterated ramen comfort. The Daikoku Ramen is a rich, porky hug in a bowl, and don't skip the perfectly greasy gyoza‚Äîexpect a wait, but it's part of the experience.

personalization.forUser: Expect a wait, but the classic, pork-broth ramen here is comforting and hits the spot ‚Äî it's a solid, no-frills option.

reviews.text:
Daikokuya Little Tokyo absolutely delivers. The curry udon with chicken was rich, deeply savory, and perfectly balanced‚Äîthick, chewy noodles in a comforting curry broth with tender chicken, onions, and carrots. The shrimp tempura on the side was light, crisp, and golden, not greasy at all, with a clean dipping sauce that let the shrimp shine.

You can feel the energy of the place the moment you walk in‚Äîbusy kitchen, fast-moving staff, and that unmistakable Little Tokyo buzz. Everything came out hot and fresh, and the portions were generous without being overwhelming.

If you‚Äôre craving authentic, satisfying Japanese comfort food in Little Tokyo, this spot lives up to the reputation. I‚Äôd come back in a heartbeat.
reviews.author: Daveed Tuck

reviews.text:
I‚Äôve been coming in and out of Little Tokyo in Downtown LA for about 25 years, and this place has always stood out as one of the most well-known ramen shops in the area. It‚Äôs consistently busy, often crowded, and parking around here has never been easy‚Äîwhich already tells you how popular it is.
I‚Äôve eaten here a few times over the years, and the most distinctive feature of their ramen is the broth. It‚Äôs extremely rich, thick, and hearty, with a very deep flavor. The soup is definitely on the bold side and can taste a bit salty, but if you enjoy a heavy, intense tonkotsu-style broth, this is likely right up your alley.
Personally, I wouldn‚Äôt say this is my absolute favorite ramen spot, but I also don‚Äôt assume my taste matches everyone else‚Äôs. Given how many people have loved and supported this place for so long, I think there‚Äôs a good reason it remains such a staple.
There are paid parking lots nearby, and street parking is also available. However, street parking can be difficult to find, so I‚Äôd recommend coming either earlier in the day or later in the evening to make parking a bit easier.
If you‚Äôre visiting Downtown LA or Little Tokyo, I think Daikokuya is one of those places worth trying at least once. Experiencing their signature rich broth firsthand can be both interesting and memorable.
reviews.author: Douglas Shin

reviews.text:
This is a long overdue review (was there on Aug 8, 2025) of Daikokuya in Little Tokyo (Los Angeles), but here I go.

My brother and I just attended a Dodgers game (great game and overall great World Series between the two same teams) and were hungry. We had spent nearly $60 within Dodgers stadium and had worked up an appetite after cheering on the LA Dodgers. If you all attended a baseball, you know it takes forever to get out of the parking lot which allowed me to find local restaurants that were still operating late into the evening which brought me to Daikokuya. The number of reviewers and the the stars assigned to this business peaked my interest so we decided to check this place out.

Waitlist - yes, this place does get very busy and expect to be on the waitlist. There is also outdoor seating for those that prefer to sit outside; you can indicate your choice upon signing into the waitlist. The staff is also cognitive of waiting time and insists that all members of your party are present in order to be seated, thus those who are smaller parties such as myself and my brother, we were seated fairly quickly (waited 20-25 minutes for a party of 2).

We were seated at the counter/bar area and ordered a few dishes to share- fried gyoza, chicken karaage, takoyaki, fried rice and a california roll. The food came out fairly quick and the staff service was excellent. There were a lot of other diners there late at night as well. All in all, the food hit the spot, don't expect your mind to be blown away like a Shohei Ohtani homerun.

Recommend: Yes

One small note: the water served there was pretty tasty. Not sure if we had too much beer or something that day, but we really noticed the taste of the amazing water there.
reviews.author: Mark La

results.name: Shin-Sen-Gumi Hakata Ramen
results.summary: Customize EVERYTHING at Shin-Sen-Gumi, from noodle firmness to spice level. Go for the level 5 spice if you dare; the atmosphere is loud, lively, and feels like a real ramen shop in Japan.

personalization.forUser: Customize everything from noodle firmness to broth richness here, which is fun. The vibe is super lively, almost like a party, so maybe skip if you're not in the mood for noise.

places.address: 132 S Central Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90012, USA

reviews.text: It was our first time going and we enjoyed the food. I loved my pork cutlet bowl so much, every bite was tender! The prices aren‚Äôt outrageously expensive lol, reasonable pricing! For two people it was about 35 (including drinks)
reviews.author: azure

reviews.text: Both the ramen and the katsu curry were decent nothing extraordinary, but tasty enough to enjoy. I sat on the terrace, which was convenient, though being in Little Tokyo it didn‚Äôt really feel like a cozy or stylish atmosphere. It was a bit noisy and more of a casual, quick stop vibe than a place to linger. The service was fine and the food came out fairly quickly. Overall, it‚Äôs a solid spot if you‚Äôre nearby and craving Japanese comfort food, but not the kind of restaurant I‚Äôd go out of my way to visit again.
reviews.author: M M

reviews.text: I first came here back in 2017, let me tell you; I‚Äôve moved many times since and tried various places for anything similar to this-and was always disappointed. The Hakata Ramen is something out of this world üî• . Anytime I‚Äôm in town I HAVE TO come here. Back then they used to sell Chashu Eggrolls and I LOVED them SO MUCH! I was so sad to order them and they didn‚Äôt understand what I meant (it was a while since they‚Äôve sold them and I hope they bring them back) . The video & Eggrolls photo is from 2017 vs the now (the bowl is black) . Back then it was pretty cheap, 8.50 for a Hakata Bowl and now it‚Äôs 13.75. If I have anything to complain about is that-they don‚Äôt sell the Chashu Eggrolls ! PLEASE!!! üôèüèΩ #ForeverCustomer
reviews.author: Eleane Ramirez

results.name: Killer Noodle Tsujita
results.summary: Prepare for serious heat at Killer Noodle‚Äîthis isn't your typical ramen spot. Order the Tokyo-style Dan Dan noodles with extra 'killer' spice if you're a chili oil fiend; it's a fiery, numbing experience that's strangely addictive.

personalization.forUser: Spice fiend? This is your playground. The Dan Dan noodles let you control the heat level ‚Äì perfect if you're seeking something fiery.

places.address: 2030 Sawtelle Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90025, USA

reviews.text: Good ramen place, but I‚Äôd suggest ordering normal menu items. The spicy dan dan noodles were rather sickening and filling rather quickly, leaving me unable to finish. The service is quite slow, but the place is great and spacious for hangouts compared to other restaurants in Sawtelle Japantown.
reviews.author: Jayden Kusuma

reviews.text:
July 2025 update

The Baseline: For a ramen restaurant the noodles must be fresh, cooked with consistency in firmness, broth must be tasty with good body, accompaniment additions must match with the style, and the plating must work for the ramen presentation/function.

Food: Still my top ramen place in Los Angeles.  My appetite gets killed at Killer Noodle!  Tokyo Style ramen with the thick rich broth and the noodles are so well made.  They just grab the sauce and makes it cling to them.  My friend had the White Mayo and tried my Tokyo and he will be headed for Japan in his food ordering in the future.  The White Mayo is still a great choice though.

Service: Good service when we came and we did not have to wait much for anything.

Ambiance: With the owners fixing up their Tsujita sister store I hope Killer Noodle gets her update too, but not at the cost of missing out on my Ramen.  Still it is clean and comfortable but there are some needs for updates in the restaurant.

Original Review:
The Baseline: For a ramen restaurant the noodles must be fresh, cooked with consistency in firmness, broth must be tasty with good body, accompaniment additions must match with the style, and the plating must work for the ramen presentation/function.

Food: Five stars for broth and noodles.  Four stars for the add ins and extra dishes.  Tokyo style beats Downtown style in my opinion because the body of the broth isn‚Äôt competing with extra vinegar.  The base bowl of ramen is about a respectable $18 so add one will kick up the cost.  Since measuring you numbness/spice levels is stirred into the base cost and the base ingredients is all you need the ramen is a five star dish.

Service: If it gets busy then wait staff are busy.  You will have to flag down your server so expect this in evening service.  Lunch will be more tame and enjoyable when it comes to service.  Water decanter chilled on the table lets me control my own water glass.

Atmosphere:  Killer Noodle is well decorated and has a consistent style.  The seats are comfortable and the tables are well situated with a good amount of eating area.  The outdoor patio has heating lamp so you will be okay outside in the winter.
reviews.author: The Baseline

reviews.text: Crowded on a Saturday evening. Good service. Downtown DanDan was average...a bit was too spicy for a standard level 3. The other dish that we ordered was similar, Downtown DanDan dry noodles, too spicy üî•ü•µ
reviews.author: Mao N

results.name: Ramen Nagi
results.summary: Ramen Nagi lets you design your own ramen masterpiece. The 'Original King' is a solid base, but experiment with the garlic, spice, and pork options to create your perfect bowl; it can get overwhelming, but that's part of the fun.

personalization.forUser: Another customizable ramen experience, but Nagi goes even further with unique monthly creations. Worth checking out for adventurous palates.

places.address: 10250 Santa Monica Blvd Ste. #2850, Los Angeles, CA 90067, USA

reviews.text:
I visited Ramen Nagi and ordered the Original King (Tonkotsu) with mushroom, cabbage, egg, and chashu.

The ramen was fine, noodle texture was good but the taste was honestly just mediocre at best. It didn‚Äôt wow me, especially after seeing such a long line outside. I was probably expecting more.

The service was mixed. The host was friendly and welcoming, but the waiter seemed overwhelmed and made us feel rushed. I get that the space is tight and they‚Äôre busy, but I still want to enjoy my meal (especially when it was extremely hot) without feeling pushed out.

Overall, it wasn‚Äôt a bad experience, just not memorable. I‚Äôm not sure I‚Äôd come back, it didn‚Äôt feel worth the wait.
reviews.author: Colton C

reviews.text:
First time I had this was actually in Hong Kong. They are called Butao Ramen before.
They rebranded to Ramen Nagi in other markets.

They serve legit tonkotsu ramen at a reasonable price.
$15 for the original tonkotsu and $17 for the squid ink one. Not bad at all.

One thing I don‚Äôt like is the long line. Good thing the lines settled down and the service was very fast now!

‚Äî

Friday night, there was a short line. I was alone and got a spot with just about 5 minutes of wait in line.

I tried the original one today. It was pretty legit and only $16.95. Quite reasonable.

I can‚Äôt stop eating the dashi sprouts üå±.

‚Äî
One tip - always order noodles as extra firm
reviews.author: Kendrick Khoe

reviews.text:
I‚Äôve eaten a lot of ramen in my life, and this was honestly one of the worst I‚Äôve ever had. I came in with very high expectations after reading the reviews, but after the first bite, I was shocked by how bad it was. I ordered the lamb ramen, karaage, and gyoza.

The karaage had a strange taste, and they added onions to the Japanese mayo, which made it taste off. The gyoza was okay, but there was barely any sauce.

Now, the ramen‚Ä¶ where do I even start? The broth had a very odd flavor that‚Äôs hard to describe and was extremely oily ‚Äî if you let it sit for a few seconds, a layer of oil would form on top. The meat had no seasoning and was completely bland.

Overall, it was not a good experience, and I highly doubt I‚Äôll be coming back.
reviews.author: faisal alsalem

results.name: Tatsu Ramen
results.summary: Tatsu is a solid late-night option when that ramen craving hits. The Bold ramen is a popular choice, but honestly, the broth can be a bit one-dimensional; it's more about convenience and the cool, minimalist vibe.

personalization.forUser: A solid, quick, and affordable ramen option. It's not groundbreaking, but it'll scratch that ramen itch without breaking the bank.

places.address: 7111 Melrose Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90046, USA

reviews.text: It's an easy going place for some delicious ramen. We had the vegan options - both were really good. Keep in mind, the naked ramen is without broth. The server was really nice and gave us vegan broth on the side. Furikake fries are a new item on the menu, and amazingly done. Spicy edmame also added to the flavours and we had a really nice lunch overall.
reviews.author: Akshay Jain

reviews.text:
Okay so this is some damn good food. Like seriously good. Got the cheeky ramen and a chicken bun. The chicken bun was super good, it had some sort of mayo and seaweed and absolutely stuffed with chicken. Which it better be for $9. The cheeky ramen was buttery, tasted healthy and was a good size. The downside was that there's no option for spiciness so even though it was real good, would have preferred an optional spice level.

This place nailed the packaging too for takeout. Travel time was close to 25 minutes, everything was warm. They also packaged the ramen separately from the toppings, which is just genius.

Opposing the delicious grub, the restaurant itself is pretty small, and ordering/payment is done through 2 tablets. Also, never have I seen this place without a line, got stupid lucky when I pulled up Christmas day. Immediately after I ordered, like 30 people pulled up.

Overall, would highly recommend this spot. Takeout definitely shines but dine in is probably equally as good.
reviews.author: mo money

reviews.text: I really like the spicy ramen, and the dumpling appetizer. However order process is a bit of a mess. We got seat after waiting for table to be clean. But after we sat down that we realize 4 table that came after us got their food served before we did. I understand it‚Äôs suppose to be an in and out type of restaurant, but there should be some urgency to serve you customer base on fist come fist serve and not
reviews.author: C S

results.name: Silverlake Ramen
results.summary: Silverlake Ramen nails the trendy, Instagrammable ramen experience. The creamy tonkotsu broth is decent, but the real draw is the overall aesthetic; it's a good spot if you want a stylish, modern take on ramen.

personalization.forUser: The creamy broth here is a crowd-pleaser, and the vibe is pretty chill. A good spot for a low-key ramen night.

places.address: 2927 Sunset Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90026, USA

reviews.text:
I love coming to this location! The parking is $7 but parking is also accessible down the neighborhood. Their combos are a really good deal, I totally recommend. My favorite is the shoyu on fire ramen paired with either the gyoza or the edamame (the spicy one is Soo good!!).
I recommend signing up via Yelp to reserve your seats. The staff is always VERY friendly & hardworking. Thank you so much to our waitress Kat, she was very attentive and provided a great experience.
reviews.author: Maritza Rosas

reviews.text:
This place is mind blowing! The flavors make you giggle like a chubby kid in a candy store. I smiled and danced after every morsel. My cheeks were redder than Santa on the 26th of December.
Make the inner child happy by stopping here.
reviews.author: Jay Jay

reviews.text:
It‚Äôs a small place, but the atmosphere was nice for the two of us.
We ordered the Blaze, and the broth was so delicious!
The spicy seasoning comes out clumped in the soup, so if you mix it all in it gets too spicy ‚Äî mixing in about half makes it just right.
I‚Äôm not usually a fan of ramen, but I really enjoyed it.
reviews.author: Yuan M

results.name: Jinya Ramen Bar
results.summary: Jinya is a reliable chain for a reason‚Äîthey deliver consistent quality. The Spicy Chicken Ramen is a standout, with a flavorful broth and tender chicken; it's not groundbreaking, but it's a solid choice when you're craving something familiar.

personalization.forUser: Jinya's a reliable chain, so you know what you're getting. It's a safe bet for a consistent ramen experience, but maybe not as exciting if you're after something unique.

places.address: 700 Wilshire Blvd Suite B, Los Angeles, CA 90017, USA

reviews.text: was over at the Downtown LA location and had a delicious meal, I ordered the spicy chicken ramen which was yummy, the tender chicken delicious with perfectly cooked noodles, and the fresh toppings made it one of the best ramen bowls I‚Äôve had in the city. The staff were welcoming and quick to seat us, the restaurant has a relaxed yet modern vibe that makes it a fun spot for both casual dinners and bigger group outings, will come again.
reviews.author: Evert Orn

reviews.text:
The food was excellent, and the ramen instantly lifted my mood. The flavors blended beautifully, with just the right level of spice, flavorful without being overpowering. Its location within walking distance of the hotel made the experience even better, combining good eats with a pleasant walk.

The wait staff were attentive and offered thoughtful recommendations, which added to the overall positive experience. I also enjoyed the welcoming ambience.

Having also visited the Jinya Ramen in DC, I find myself partial to that location‚Äîperhaps because it feels newer...but both delivered consistently great flavors in the dishes I ordered.
reviews.author: Melody Carr

reviews.text:
I was looking for options near our hotel and was pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. I was expecting overcooked noodles in a bland broth but it was very flavorful and made well. My mom and I both enjoyed our Tan Tan Men which was nutty, creamy and a bit meaty with a hint of spice. If you‚Äôre into more toppings, be sure to add it separately because it‚Äôs topped simply with flavored ground beef, green onion and bok choy. It was still very filling without extra toppings.

My sister got the Red Tonkatsu and while she liked it, she thought the spice level at 6 overpowered everything else. It wasn‚Äôt spicy to her but just a bit one dimensional. She said she would like to give the original a try instead. The egg wasn‚Äôt jammy but we‚Äôre aware some ramen places like to cook it differently.

We also got an order of the takoyaki- it was good. The hot sake also comes in a large craft and sodas are in cans or bottles (Mexican Cola).

The service was great even though there was only one active server, Via. They were great and attentive. Probably not ideal for large groups but there are hightop tables that can accommodate them. The atmosphere was warm woods and slightly industrial but it was lit well with warm and bright lighting. Very clean and organized.

Value is stretch but I‚Äôd come eat here again if I were to stay at the same hotel.
reviews.author: Dawn Castro

turns.query: restaurants good for large groups in Brooklyn

results.name: Roberta's Pizza
results.summary: Roberta's backyard is a low-key party, and the Bee Sting pizza (chili oil and honey!) is a revelation. It's a chaotic, communal vibe that's perfect for a big group ready to get loud and share pies.

personalization.forUser: Forget it, Jordan. Loud, long waits, and zero echoes of the jazz you love. Plus, it's pizza, not even close to your craving for Thai.

reviews.text:
Buzzy/noisey atmosphere at the entrance, good host and reception with drinks at the bar before table was ready. Waiters not really alert, they messed up with my order, still smiley at least.
The pizza is very good/authentic Italian, average price 20 dollars each, but the service is very slow(and I mean it). Can‚Äôt say I loved the dessert as I left most of the pancake. Will still be definitely back as the it‚Äôs probably best pizza in Brooklyn.
reviews.author: Riccardo

reviews.text: A very local place, which creates an excellent atmosphere. Their pizza oven looks and smells incredible, but in the end, the result isn't anything amazing. I ordered a pasta dish with guanciale, which had more pepper than guanciale flavor, and the pizza, even though I ordered the "most popular" one, wasn't bad, but it wasn't anything special either, considering the incredible oven they have.
reviews.author: Brian Guti√©rrez

reviews.text: Kitchen cool Brooklyn vibe. Indoor and outside seating.  2 bars. The one we were at you could get food from, but every time you went back up for anything such as a drink or anything like that you had to stand on an enormously long line and wait quite a while, which wasn't great. The meatballs were very good, and the regular and Margherita pies were very tasty. Crust was soft, not crispy and thin.
reviews.author: Kevin Shapiro

results.name: Fette Sau
results.summary: The brisket at Fette Sau is legendary for a reason, but don't sleep on the pulled pork ‚Äî it's smoky, tender, and everything you want in BBQ. The industrial-chic vibe, with long communal tables, makes it perfect for a casual group feast, though be warned, it gets LOUD.

personalization.forUser: Okay, so maybe BBQ isn't your usual jam, but picture this: you're sharing massive platters with your crew, and they have a killer bourbon selection that'll make even a jazz aficionado like you happy. Plus, it's LOUD, so you can chat without feeling like you're in a library.

reviews.text: Loved this BBQ restaurant.  I'm sad that they'll be closing.  The place has a cozy country vibe with picnic tables and a bar with stools made from tractor seats.  The Brisket was very good and the Cornbread was amazing.  They have a good Draft selection and their Smoked Old Fashioned was very good.  The service is good.  The prices are very reasonable.  The music is Country Music.  I enjoyed it.
reviews.author: Vivianne Barretto

reviews.text: Delicious and greatly achieved southern barbeque vibe restaurant. You order what you want by the pound, so you pay exactly for the amount of meat that you are eating. Everything was cooked to perfection. It was fall and we were still able to sit outside and have a great time. Totally recommended
reviews.author: diegobatt

reviews.text:
If you‚Äôre craving authentic BBQ with personality, FatSauce is a must.
Tucked in a fun, buzzy Brooklyn neighborhood, this spot brings serious summer vibes with a touch of German beer hall charm. From the moment you step in, it‚Äôs an experience ‚Äî everyone behind the counter knows their role: one slicing brisket, another plating up generous sides, someone pouring that dangerously good honey peach punch at the bar.

The beef brisket is incredibly meaty, each cut with its own texture and story. The pork ribs? Juicy and fall-off-the-bone tender. Even the bread is worth a shout-out ‚Äî warm, fluffy, and perfect for mopping up sauce. Sides like slaw, mac, and pickles are spot on.

What makes it extra fun is the open, outdoor seating area ‚Äî casual, lively, and full of energy.
And best of all? Prices are honest, portions are real, and the vibe is just good.
If BBQ is your thing, don‚Äôt miss this one! üçó üçñ üçπ
reviews.author: Zoe

results.name: Lilia
results.summary: The mafaldine with pink peppercorn is worth the trip alone ‚Äî Lilia's buzzing energy on weekend nights makes it a blast for groups, though you'll want to book *months* early. The wood-fired seafood dishes are also incredible, and the entire vibe is upscale-casual.

personalization.forUser: Okay, so Lilia is HUGE right now, and getting a table for a large group is going to be tough. That said, the handmade pasta is incredible and the vibe is energetic and fun, but maybe not the best place to chill and listen to jazz.

reviews.text:
Super friendly staff and a great place to spend an evening catching up with friends. We booked a 6pm patio table, so we didn‚Äôt see much of the inside, but it was packed so reservations are a must.

The patio was perfect though, plenty of separation from the sidewalk and a comfortable setup. Most importantly, the food was fantastic. It‚Äôs not cheap, but the portions were fair and everything felt thoughtfully prepared with real attention to detail.

If I were to recommend two things, it would be the focaccia and the agnolotti, they were the table favorites.

Overall, we had a great experience and would absolutely recommend it.
reviews.author: Rohin Gupta

reviews.text:
I usually hear people going before they open to get a table, and was so excited that I was able to reserve online!

The staff were nice and helpful with deciding our orders, and we were glad that we did not skip on the focaccia!

I was way too full afterwards, so I think the 2 of us could‚Äôve just gotten one pasta instead of 2 (or just one appetizer)!
reviews.author: Vicki

reviews.text:
The service at this place is truly amazing! The food is good, but nothing special enough to make me want to return. For the scallops, you only get two small pieces for $30.
The pastas we tried received big recommendations, but they were lacking flavor.
The only thing I liked is the apple crostata. I wish it came with ice cream not the creme fraiche.
reviews.author: Anja A.

results.name: Cecconi's Dumbo
results.summary: Come for the stunning Manhattan skyline views that regulars rave about, stay for the perfect cacio e pepe. It's a reliably chic spot with a lively, buzzy atmosphere that's ideal for a celebratory group dinner.

personalization.forUser: Forget it, Jordan. It's all scene and no substance, plus the noise level will drown out any hope of hearing some decent jazz.

reviews.text: We celebrated our anniversary here and couldn‚Äôt have picked a better spot. The team was incredibly kind and attentive and they set us up with an amazing view of the Brooklyn Bridge that made the night feel even more special. The food was outstanding. The pastas were perfectly prepared, tasting truly authentic and homemade, and the salmon was cooked to perfection, moist and flavorful with no dryness at all. An unforgettable experience from start to finish.
reviews.author: Joshua Dyer

reviews.text:
I visited Cecconi‚Äôs with my friend and left feeling a little mixed. The space itself is undeniably beautiful, and the view of the Brooklyn Bridge is really something. It looks like the kind of place where the food should blow you away, but it didn‚Äôt quite match the vibe.

We ordered the Orechiette Arrabbiata, Eggplant Parmigiana, and two Tea Amo desserts. The pasta was alright, but the eggplant parm felt underwhelming, especially for the price. I also wish they had more vegetarian options on the menu. For such an impressive restaurant, the selection felt limited. The drinks were good I enjoyed that for sure.

Parking in the area is rough, so plan for extra time if you‚Äôre driving.

The highlight of the night was the service. Our host, Juan, was genuinely kind and attentive. When I mentioned I didn‚Äôt love the eggplant parm, he surprised us with cookies on the house, which I really appreciated.

Overall, amazing ambiance and great service, but the food didn‚Äôt fully deliver for me.
reviews.author: Anju Sehgal

reviews.text:
Went for an early birthday celebration to Cecconi‚Äôs in Dumbo and had a wonderful time. The food was good, service was great, and the views were beautiful. One thing to note is that it is located in the same building as the Time Out Market, so we were walking around looking for a separate building for a few minutes until we realized.
